# Cambridge International AS & A Level

CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 875, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined pages at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 574]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 605]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 856, 636]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 77, 96, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
Find the roots of the equation \(z^{3} = - 108\sqrt{3} + 108\mathrm{i}\), giving your answers in the form \(r(\cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta)\), where \(r > 0\) and \(0 < \theta < 2\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 92, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 235, 88]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[323, 100, 720, 121]]<|/det|>
\[x = \sin^{-1}t \quad \text{and} \quad y = t\cos^{-1}t, \quad \text{for } 0\leqslant t<1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 131, 144, 151]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 127, 443, 152]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = -t + \sqrt{1 - t^2}\cos^{-1}t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[217, 87, 776, 313]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 327, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 2x - x^2\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles of width \(\frac{1}{n}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 375, 146, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 371, 895, 406]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that \(\int_{0}^{1}(2x - x^{2})\mathrm{d}x < U_{n}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 403, 920, 435]]<|/det|>
\[U_{n} = \left(1 + \frac{1}{n}\right)\left(\frac{2}{3} -\frac{1}{6n}\right). \quad [5]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 787, 102]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound \(L_{n}\) for \(\int_{0}^{1}(2x - x^{2})\mathrm{d}x\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 603, 388, 625]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\lim_{n \to \infty} (U_n - L_n) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 605, 920, 624]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 96, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 79, 143, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 77, 425, 101]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\left(\cosh x + \sinh x\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} = \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 918, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 514, 181, 533]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 514, 583, 535]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 536, 641, 572]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} +\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} +3y = 5\big(\cosh x + \sinh x\big)^{\frac{1}{2}},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 585, 494, 616]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = 1\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{4}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 590, 920, 611]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 631, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 97, 567, 116]]<|/det|>
\[6x + ay = 3,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 117, 567, 136]]<|/det|>
\[2x - y = 1,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 138, 562, 157]]<|/det|>
\[x + 5y + 4z = 2\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 329, 182]]<|/det|>
has a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 186, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 536, 757, 554]]<|/det|>
Show that the system of equations in part (a) is consistent for all values of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 541, 91]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 98, 611, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\left(14\mathbf{A} + 24\mathbf{I}\right)^{2} = \mathbf{A}^{4}\left(\mathbf{A} + b\mathbf{I}\right)^{2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 462, 152]]<|/det|>
where \(b\) is an integer to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 72, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
## Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
